The '''father-name'''<ref group="note">There is no attested Quenya term for this name, but we can conjecture it is ''ataressë''.</ref> was the name given to an [[Elves|Elf]] at or near birth by his or her father, and was considered one of his or her 'true names'. It is one of the '''[[essë#anessi|anessi]]''', or given names, of [[High Elves]], along with the '''[[amilessë]]''' ("mother-name") and '''[[epessë]]''' ("after-name" or honorific). The father-name was a public name, announced in a ceremony called ''Essecarmë'' ("name-making").<ref>{{MR|P3II3a}}, p. 214-5</ref> It was often the primary name of an Elf until he or she chose to adopt an epessë given to them.<ref>{{PM|Mother}}, p. 339</ref>

An example is [[Finrod|Finrod Felagund]], whose father-name was Findaráto ("[Golden-]Haired Champion")<ref name="Descend">{{PM|Finwe}}, p. 346</ref> and epessë was Felagund ("Hewer of Caves").<ref>{{PM|Felagund}}, p. 351</ref> The name Finrod is the [[Sindarin]] version of his father-name.
